meanings.definition: A symbol in the form of an equal-armed cross with each arm continued at a right angle, used in various cultures as a religious or decorative symbol.
meanings.sent1: The swastica was painted on the wall as a symbol of peace and harmony.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, the swastica represents good luck and prosperity.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, they hung a swastica made of colorful ribbons as a festive decoration.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up her face like a radiant swastica shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the swastica was etched into the ancient stone monument.

meanings.definition: A symbol resembling a swastika, used in ancient Greek art and architecture.
meanings.sent1: The swastica on the vase depicted a pattern similar to the one on the temple.
meanings.sent2: Art historians study the swastica motifs found in Greek pottery.
meanings.sent3: The artist playfully incorporated a swastica into the mosaic, adding a touch of whimsy.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of the swastica cast by the setting sun created a striking silhouette.
meanings.sent5: The swastica carved on the pillar stood out against the marble background.
